intro: Morisonia martiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian starwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals that open in the morning and close in the evening. Morisonia martiana is an important part of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
